SpeechRecognitionResult.summary: The SpeechRecognitionResult interface of the Web Speech API represents a single recognition match, which may contain multiple objects.

SpeechRecognitionResultIsFinal.summary:
The isFinal read-only property of the
interface is a boolean value that states
whether this result is final (true) or not (false) — if so,
then this is the final time this result will be returned; if not, then this result is an
interim result, and may be updated later on.

SpeechRecognitionResultItem.summary:
The item getter of the
interface is a standard getter that allows
objects within the result to be accessed via
array syntax.

SpeechRecognitionResultLength.summary:
The length read-only property of the
interface returns the length of the "array"
— the number of objects contained
in the result (also referred to as "n-best alternatives".)

remarks.para:
The number of alternatives contained in the result depends on what the
property was set to when the speech
recognition was first initiated.
